title: UK Rapper Giggs Takes Center Stage as NFL Spices Up International Games With Halftime¬†Shows
summary: Giggs has done collaborations with artists including Drake, 21 Savage and Ed Sheeran.
body: The NFL has been spicing up its international games with halftime performers, a bit like mini-Super Bowls. British rapper Giggs performed Sunday (Oct. 12) at halftime of the game between the New York Jets and Denver Broncos at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium. The Broncos won 13-11. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a huge moment to be a part of the London Games,‚Äù Giggs said. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve been on a journey with my music, and to get to share that with my city and the NFL fans is something I‚Äôm really proud of.‚Äù The south London native‚Äôs 2007 single ‚ÄúTalkin‚Äô da Hardest‚Äù remains a popular anthem among his fans. Cleveland Browns players unfamiliar with the song  liked what they heard  when it was played last week. Giggs has done collaborations with artists including Drake, 21 Savage, Ed Sheeran and Dave. Last week, British singer Raye performed a halftime show at Tottenham with a nearly seven-minute set that included her hit ‚ÄúWhere is My Husband!‚Äù The Minnesota Vikings beat Cleveland 21-17 in the game. British singer-songwriter Myles Smith was chosen to headline the halftime show at the first-ever regular-season NFL game in Ireland. At Croke Park, the Pittsburgh Steelers beat the Vikings 24-21 two weeks ago. Last mon‚Ä¶

title: Chappell Roan Secures Her Greatness at Final L.A. ‚ÄòDamsels‚Äô Show: 5 Best¬†Moments
summary: The star proved she's one of her generation's most compelling performers at the concluding show of her limited U.S. pop-up tour.
body: Chappell Roan concluded the six-show U.S. leg of her Visions of Damsels & Other Dangerous Things tour in Pasadena, Calif., on Saturday night (Oct. 11) with a transcendent set that helped cement her status as one of the greatest performers of her generation. Drawing a star-studded crowd that included SZA , Pedro Pascal, Sarah Paulson, Kesha and Tove Lo , Roan ‚Äî dressed in a sparkly green two-piece bikini paired with matching Wonder Woman-esque forearm cuffs and knee-high boots ‚Äî plowed through a set that included the majority of songs from her star-making debut album, The Rise and Fall of a Midwest Princess , along with standalone smashes ‚ÄúGood Luck, Babe!‚Äù and ‚ÄúThe Subway‚Äù and a fierce cover of Heart‚Äôs ‚ÄúBarracuda.‚Äù Related Chappell Roan Thanks Fans for ‘Sticking With Me’ Through ‘Really Hard’ Year at Triumphant NYC Homecoming Show Prior to Roan‚Äôs emergence on stage, fans were treated to a festival-like atmosphere at the Rose Bowl-adjacent Brookside Park, made up into what might best be described as ‚ÄúChappellchella.‚Äù In addition to a plethora of food booths and merch stations, attendees were spoiled for choice in terms of Instagram-worthy photo opps‚Ä¶

title: ‚ÄòGood Morning America‚Äô Teases ‚ÄòHuge‚Äô Taylor Swift ‚ÄòThe Life of a Showgirl‚Äô¬†Announcement
summary: The pop superstar‚Äôs 12th album is already shattering multiple sales records.
body: Good Morning America is teasing a big reveal involving Taylor Swift . On Sunday (Oct. 12), the ABC morning show shared a ‚Äúhuge new exclusive announcement‚Äù on social media, hinting at news tied to the 35-year-old pop superstar‚Äôs 12th studio album, The Life of a Showgirl . Related Taylor Swift’s ‘The Life of a Showgirl’ Breaks Modern-Era Single-Week U.S. Album Sales Record Taylor Swift Reveals Whether She Plans to Tour for ‘Life of a Showgirl’: ‘I Would Want to Do It Really Well Again’ How Do We Grade the Rollout for Taylor Swift’s ‘The Life of a Showgirl’ at This New Commercial Peak? “TOMORROW: We‚Äôre keep it üíØ with an exclusive Taylor Swift announcement! Tune in ONLY on GMA!” the show wrote on Instagram . The post includes a clip from Swift‚Äôs ‚ÄúThe Fate of Ophelia‚Äù video, accompanied by a voiceover that says, ‚ÄúShe‚Äôs at it again. Taylor Swift shattering records with the biggest album debut in history with over four million units. And now tomorrow morning, GMA has a huge new exclusive announcement on Taylor. So what‚Äôs next for her? Find out on Good Morning America .” It was unclear at press t‚Ä¶

title: Chappell Roan Told to ‚ÄòGet a Grip‚Äô by Homeland Security Over ‚ÄòF‚Äîk ICE‚Äô Remark at Rose Bowl¬†Show
summary: The pop star took the stage at Brookside at the Rose Bowl in L.A. on Oct. 10‚Äì11.
body: Chappell Roan is facing criticism from the U.S. Department of Homeland Security following comments she made during a recent concert in Los Angeles. During the first of two performances at Brookside at the Rose Bowl in Pasadena, California, on Friday (Oct. 10), the 27-year-old pop star paused her hit-filled set to reflect on her appreciation for her adopted hometown. Related Chappell Roan Says Next Album ‘Doesn’t Exist Yet,’ Could Take ‘At Least 5’ Years to Finish Zach Bryan Condemns ICE & ‘Cocky Motherf–ker’ Cops in New Song Teaser Donald Trump Adviser Says ICE Agents Will Be at Bad Bunny’s ‘Shameful’ Super Bowl Halftime Show ‚ÄúL.A.‚Äôs my favorite city in the world, to be honest,‚Äù Roan told the crowd, according to Variety . ‚ÄúI‚Äôve been living here nine years. I‚Äôm originally from Missouri and I had a really, really tough time the first five years.” She went on to speak about the recent wildfires in the Los Angeles area and the community‚Äôs response. “I‚Äôm not gonna be eloquent about this,” she continued. “I loved L.A. more than ever than when I saw how the community came together‚Ä¶

title: Charli XCX Makes Surprise Cameo in Role Model‚Äôs ‚ÄòSally‚Äô Performance on ‚ÄòSaturday Night Live‚Äô:¬†Watch
summary: The singer-songwriter made his SNL debut alongside host Amy Poehler.
body: Role Model had a surprise in store for his Saturday Night Live musical guest debut. The 28-year-old singer-songwriter, born Tucker Pillsbury, appeared on the Oct. 11 episode of the long-running NBC sketch comedy show to perform two tracks from the deluxe edition of his second album, Kansas Anymore . Related Charli XCX Gets Intro From Julia Fox, Performs ‘360’ and ‘Sympathy Is a Knife’ on ‘SNL’: Watch Bad Bunny Fires Back at 2026 Super Bowl Halftime Show Backlash in ‘SNL’ Monologue: Watch Every Sketch From the 51st Season Premiere of ‘SNL’ Ranked After an introduction from host ‚Äî and former SNL cast member ‚Äî Amy Poehler , Role Model opened with his breakout hit, ‚ÄúSally, When the Wine Runs Out,‚Äù which recently reached No. 1 on Billboard ‚Äôs Adult Alternative Airplay chart. Set against a moody barnyard backdrop, complete with haystacks and a wooden ladder, he took the stage in a brown shirt and sparkly blue jeans to deliver the upbeat track. In previous live performances, he‚Äôs brought celebrities and fans alike ‚Äî including Natalie Portman, Olivia Rodrigo and Troye Sivan ‚Äî to step in as “Sally.” His SNL debut ‚Ä¶

title: Tested: Google‚Äôs new GPU is a disaster for Pixel 10 game emulation
summary: Tensor's bold changes have backfired, badly.
body: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pzuUlkaqkKc The Google Pixel 10 series brings a familiar polish and plenty of new features, but its most interesting, and arguably most controversial, change lies deep inside the Tensor G5 chip . Google has ditched its long-standing partnership with Arm‚Äôs Mali GPU range in favor of Imagination Technologies‚Äô DXT-48-1536 graphics unit. On paper, that‚Äôs a major shift ‚Äî but after a week of testing, I‚Äôm not convinced it‚Äôs for the better. At first, everything seemed fine. The Pixel 10 Pro XL handles popular Android games smoothly enough, with no significant slowdowns or stability issues during my short tests. But things started to look less rosy when I dug deeper, especially into emulator performance.

title: I thought ads would be the most annoying part of Spotify‚Äôs free plan; instead, it was this
summary: Forced shuffle was actually the most frustrating part of the experience.
body: After years on Spotify‚Äôs Premium plan , I switched over to the music streaming service‚Äôs free version in an effort to save money. I‚Äôve seen how intrusive ads have become across different platforms, including websites, podcasts, and YouTube videos; so I braced myself for an onslaught of annoying breaks while streaming music. But my experience differed greatly from what I expected. The ads turned out to be minor inconveniences, with the lack of control over my music playback being much more annoying than expected.

title: 7 features you should expect from 2026 flagship Android phones
summary: Whether it's super-dim displays or higher quality video, here's what to expect from 2026's phones.
body: Credit: Robert Triggs / Android Authority This was a significant year for Android phones , as several innovations and improvements were keenly felt. Whether it‚Äôs the Snapdragon 8 Elite‚Äôs huge CPU performance leap, the continued rise of silicon-carbon batteries, durability improvements, or slick camera hardware, there were several notable trends in this generation. Technology waits for no one, though, and next-generation smartphone processors have already been revealed. We‚Äôve even seen the first next-generation high-end phones in the Xiaomi 17 series . With all that in mind, I thought it would be a good idea to look at the features you should expect in 2026‚Äôs flagship Android phones.

title: Gemini is better on my old Pixel than the Pixel 10, thanks to one forgotten feature
summary: Back in the days when you could squeeze your Pixel.
body: We‚Äôve been talking nonstop about the Pixel 10 series since its announcement in August. And for good reason: there‚Äôs a lot to discuss! Between new camera features, Pixelsnap, and new AI tools, the Pixel 10 family has kept us busy. As with all Pixel phones released over the last couple of years, a big selling point for the Pixel 10 is Gemini. Google‚Äôs Tensor G5 chip enables faster and more reliable Gemini interactions on the Pixel 10, and while that‚Äôs great, I‚Äôd argue that ‚Äî despite what Google leads you to believe ‚Äî the Pixel 10 isn‚Äôt the best phone for Gemini.

title: As console prices increase, I‚Äôve never been more thankful for emulation handhelds
summary: I'm more convinced than ever that the future of gaming is emulation handhelds.
body: Credit: Nick Fernandez / Android Authority Gaming has always been expensive, but in the past six months, it‚Äôs started to feel downright unaffordable. From consoles and controllers to games and subscriptions, prices are climbing across the board. As someone without an unlimited gaming budget, that means I‚Äôm effectively priced out of most new games. I‚Äôve mostly made up for this by revisiting my favorite retro games or snagging PC games on Steam with deep discounts, but recent developments in the Android world have given me new hope.

title: LineageOS releases Android 16 update despite challenges with Android source code
summary: LineageOS 23.0 brings Android 16 to over 100 different devices. Here's what you need to know.
body: TL;DR The LineageOS team has released LineageOS 23.0, bringing Android 16 to over 100 different devices. This release is based on the initial Android 16 release due to Google‚Äôs delay in releasing QPR1‚Äôs source code. LineageOS 23.0 includes updated versions of Aperture and Twelve, a new TV launcher, and major foundational improvements for future device support. The golden era of custom Android ROMs may be long over, but plenty of people still install them in 2025. The reasons for doing so vary: some want a more stock-like Android experience, others want to hold on to their existing device a little longer, and many want to repurpose an old device or move away from Google‚Äôs services. The most popular option is by far LineageOS , a project that provides a close-to-stock experience with additional features and its own set of apps. Today, the team behind the project released LineageOS 23.0 for over 100 devices, bringing its own flavor of Android 16 to a variety of older models.

title: Diane Keaton, Oscar-Winning Star of ‚ÄòAnnie Hall‚Äô and ‚ÄòThe Godfather,‚Äô Dies at¬†79
summary: Keaton won the Oscar for best actress in 1978 for her work in 'Annie Hall.'
body: Diane Keaton , the Oscar-winning star of Annie Hall , The Godfather films and Father of the Bride , whose quirky, vibrant manner and depth made her one of the most singular actors of a generation, has died. She was 79. People first reported Saturday (Oct. 11) that she died in California with loved ones, citing a family spokesperson. No other details were immediately available, and representatives for Keaton did not immediately respond to inquiries. The unexpected news was met with shock around the world. Keaton was the kind of actor who helped make films iconic and timeless, from her ‚ÄúLa-dee-da, la-dee-da‚Äù phrasing as Annie Hall, bedecked in that necktie, bowler hat, vest and khakis, to her heartbreaking turn as Kay Adams, the woman unfortunate enough to join the Corleone family. Her star-making performances in the 1970s, many of which were in Woody Allen films, were not a flash in the pan, and she would continue to charm new generations for decades thanks in part to a longstanding collaboration with filmmaker Nancy Meyers. Related Gone But Not Forgotten: Musicians We Lost in 2025 She played a businesswoman who unexpectedly inherits an infant in Baby Boom , the mother of the ‚Ä¶

title: Argentine Singer Fede Dorcaz Fatally Shot in Mexico Days Before TV¬†Appearance
summary: The 29-year-old was reportedly attacked during an attempted robbery.
body: Argentine singer Fede Dorcaz was shot and killed in Mexico City just days before he was set to appear on a popular Mexican television dance competition. The 29-year-old, who was also an actor and model, was fatally shot on Thursday (Oct. 9) in what authorities believe was an attempted robbery, according to The Guardian . Dorcaz was attacked shortly after leaving a dance rehearsal and was reportedly on his way home when the incident occurred. The singer, who was in a relationship with Mexican actress and singer Mariana √Åvila, had been scheduled to appear in the upcoming season of Mexican dance competition Las Estrellas Bailan en Hoy . The show paid tribute to him on Instagram , writing in Spanish, “Fede leaves a big void in our team. His memory and passion will continue to inspire us forever.” According to the Mexico City Secretariat of Public Safety, Dorcaz was shot in the neck while attempting to exit a road and died instantly at the scene, TMZ reports. Authorities are reviewing CCTV footage and have identified four male suspects seen fleeing the scene on motorcycles. No arrests had been reported at press time. Born and raised in Argentina, Dorcaz moved to Spain with ‚Ä¶

title: Google blocks Android hack that let Pixel users enable VoLTE anywhere
summary: The October 2025 Pixel update broke the app that enabled VoLTE and VoWiFi in unsupported regions.
body: TL;DR Google‚Äôs October 2025 update has broken the Pixel IMS app, a tool many used to enable VoLTE and VoWiFi on imported Pixel phones in unsupported regions. The app exploited a loophole that allowed it to override carrier settings, which Google has now patched and designated as a high-severity vulnerability (CVE-2025-48617). Fortunately, a new workaround has been discovered to enable VoLTE in unsupported regions, but users who want VoWiFi must now either root their devices or wait for Google to officially expand carrier support. Pixel phones are beloved for their many unique software features , but their limited availability prevents many people from buying them. While Google has made strides in expanding access, Pixels still aren‚Äôt sold in nearly as many countries as iPhones or Samsung Galaxy devices. This leads many fans to import Pixel phones from other markets, a move that can unfortunately break crucial calling features like VoLTE and VoWiFi. VoLTE (Voice over LTE) is the feature that routes voice calls over a 4G LTE connection, a crucial function now that carriers worldwide are phasing out their 2G and 3G networks. Without it, you might not be able to make phone calls at al‚Ä¶

title: One-click theme packs are coming to Android thanks to Google‚Äôs new Theme Manager
summary: To enable theme pack support on Android, Google has created a Theme Manager service that builds off Material You.
body: Pixel phones haven‚Äôt traditionally been known for providing extensive customization options, but that perception is changing as Google adds new home and lock screen personalization features in the latest version of Android. The introduction of Material 3 Expressive in the first quarterly release of Android 16 has dramatically overhauled the look and feel of Android on Pixel phones, bringing a fresh, more vibrant experience across the board. Still, Pixel phones lag behind some of their competitors in ease of customization. While many rival devices let you change the entire look and feel of the UI with single-click custom themes , Pixel phones lack this convenience, requiring you to manually configure the home and lock screens to achieve your desired look.

title: I ditched my Google Pixel Buds Pro 2 for these cheaper buds and I didn‚Äôt miss a thing
summary: The perfect companion to a Pixel phone now comes in a cheaper version.
body: The Pixel Buds Pro were one of my favorite buds for a couple of years, and then the Pixel Buds Pro 2 displaced them on that throne thanks to their smaller size, more comfortable fit, and the super cool twist-to-fit feature that gives me two different fits with one pair of buds. I never thought another pair of buds would take over the Buds Pro 2 this soon, but Google has surprised me with its new Pixel Buds 2a (). I expected these to become a secondary pair of buds I keep at home for short listening sessions, not the buds I take with me everywhere, but they‚Äôre so good that I don‚Äôt find myself really missing anything about my Pixel Buds Pro 2. And for nearly half the price? It‚Äôs a steal, especially for any Pixel user.

title: Data privacy: Here‚Äôs how to limit what your carrier collects
summary: There are ways to opt-out of sharing information in some cases.
body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority If you‚Äôre a Verizon, AT&T, or T-Mobile customer, you might be surprised by how much information you agree to share with your provider the moment you sign up. Some of this is expected, such as your Social Security number, home address, and payment details. Beyond that, carriers also enable settings that allow them to collect data from your web browsing, location, and more. While they do not directly access this information themselves, it is used to build advertising profiles and personalize your experience. It is also not just for internal use. The big three carriers share, and in some cases sell, personal information to other companies for targeted ads or credit checks. When you consider the steady stream of high-profile security breaches carriers have faced in recent years, it is understandable if the idea of handing over even more data makes you uneasy.

title: The Apple Watch took eleven tries to last a full day, but the Series 11 manages it
summary: Whether it's worth the buy depends on what's already on your wrist (and if you have an iPhone, obviously).
body: Apple doesn‚Äôt rewrite the playbook each fall; it just adds footnotes. The Apple Watch Series 11 is another careful revision, making reviews feel more like progress reports than breaking news. Still, refinement isn‚Äôt a bad thing when the smartwatch lineup is already one of the best (unless you have an Android phone, unfortunately). With improvements in battery life and fresh health insights, Apple inches its flagship wearable closer to a genuine all-day health companion. A familiar look that‚Äôs subtly stronger

title: It‚Äôs exceptional at cleaning, but the ECOVACS Deebot X11 OmniCyclone has one big flaw
summary: Look out below!
body: The ECOVACS Deebot X11 OmniCyclone () is capable of superb, edge-to-edge cleaning, and has AI-powered navigation tools. The roller-style mop head is an excellent tool, and the powerful vacuum has handled every mess I‚Äôve thrown at it. Along with the top-tier features on the bot itself, the base station is a step up over most. It features two detergent canisters that automatically add detergent to the bot, stores both clean and dirty water, has a large dry debris collection canister, and offers multiple bot cleaning tools.

summary: The LG Smart Monitor Swing isn't your typical computer screen.
body: Credit: LG Recent offerings have proved that monitors don‚Äôt need to be simple screens fixed to a desk. For example, the LG Smart Monitor Swing can be moved around the home or office, adapting to your needs regardless of what you‚Äôre doing. summary: At the moment, Wear OS 6 on the Pixel Watch 4, 3, and 2 does not support always-on display Media Controls, but that is coming soon. more‚Ä¶

Is one of these Google‚Äôs sta‚Ä¶

title: FCC looking to gut broadband labeling requirements, because poor ISPs need a break
summary: The agency sets its sights on broadband labeling as next thing it wants to ruin.
body: TL;DR The FCC is looking to eliminate some of its broadband labeling requirements for ISPs. Broadband ‚Äúnutrition‚Äù labels were introduced to make it easier for consumers to compare prices and services, fees inclusive. The FCC teases further interest in backpedaling on labeling requirements it believes ‚Äúprovide minimal benefit to consumers.‚Äù When you‚Äôre signing up for internet access, how confident are you about what your bill‚Äôs actually going to look like? ISPs and cellular carriers both have a reputation for positively opaque billing practices, piling on fees and passing taxes along to end users. As a consequence, responsible lawmakers pushed for legislation aimed at simplifying bills, and forcing ISPs to be upfront and clear about all their fees. But right now, current FCC leadership is doing its darndest to undo some of those changes and make things easier for the ISPs. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

Just be sure to scope out the ongoing and returning Prime Day deals on Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 7 at $400 off, the Google TV Streamer 4K at the $80 Amazon all-time low, and a massive $490 off Samsung Galaxy S25‚Ä¶

title: PSA: Alexa Plus may be why your smart clock has become useless
summary: The new premium subscription can load up your Echo Show's screen with questionably helpful content.
body: TL;DR A post on the Amazon Echo subreddit indicates that an Alexa Plus subscription can make unintended changes to Echo devices. User Setati said that their Echo Show 5 had stopped persistently showing the time on its home screen, instead surfacing news and other content. Setati says that canceling Alexa Plus removed the unwanted additional content from their Show 5‚Äôs screen. Alexa Plus is Amazon‚Äôs new paid digital assistant. Available for $20 per month (or included for free, if you‚Äôre a Prime subscriber), Alexa Plus injects extra AI functionality into your Amazon devices, like the ability to engage in more natural conversation-style interactions with Alexa through an Echo device. Turns out, it can also make some unhelpful changes to your Echo Show‚Äôs home screen. In a post on the Amazon Echo subreddit, user Setati complains that their Echo Show 5 has recently become less fit for one of their primary use cases: telling the time. Setati writes that ‚Äúabout the same time as Alexa+,‚Äù their Show 5 started showing content that it didn‚Äôt before, replacing the full-screen clock with ‚Äúnews briefs and things it thinks I want to see.‚Äù

title: Google, you have to make a red Pixel phone now [Gallery]
summary: Google keeps experimenting with new Pixel colors, but after seeing the new Nest Cam and its ‚ÄúBerry‚Äù color, all I can think about is a red Pixel phone. more‚Ä¶

title: Successor to one of the best Android camera phones could get big upgrades and two versions
summary: A new leak suggests the Xiaomi 17 Ultra may come in two models with the same quad-camera setup.
body: Credit: Robert Triggs / Android Authority TL;DR A new leak reveals a powerful potential camera setup for the Xiaomi 17 Ultra. The specs suggest that the upcoming flagship may feature a quad-sensor camera array, although this isn‚Äôt yet clear. The leaker hints at two versions of the device that share hardware but differ in ‚Äúrevolutionary‚Äù imaging features. Xiaomi‚Äôs flagships rarely disappoint when it comes to cameras, with the 15 Ultra being our top pick for premium camera phones . The next device in the series doesn‚Äôt look like it‚Äôll break this pattern. A reliable leaker has shared new details that point to big imaging upgrades for the upcoming Xiaomi 17 Ultra, and possibly two versions of the device.

title: Chrome‚Äôs got a new trick to spare you from useless notifications
summary: Combatting notification fatigue, one site at a time.
body: TL;DR Chrome will start automatically revoking notification permission for sites you don‚Äôt regularly interact with. This move follows similar steps for revoking camera and location permissions. Users can always re-allow notifications, or turn the feature off entirely. Notifications are such a double-edged sword. While tactfully deployed notifications are wonderful, keeping us informed about the things we care about most, it is far too easy to get carried away there, and once we ruin that signal-to-noise ratio with too many unwanted notifications , they all start becoming a lot less useful. Thankfully, developers are aware of the risks here, and have been working to develop systems designed to help us regain control and keep our notifications as beneficial as possible. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Chrome will turn off notifications from sites you don‚Äôt often visit
summary: To help reduce notification overload, Chrome for Android and desktop will automatically disable notifications from websites you don‚Äôt frequently visit. more‚Ä¶

title: Pixel Watch 4 gets a near-perfect reparability score and sets a new smartwatch standard
summary: The secret to Google's best wearable yet? Screws instead of glue.
body: TL;DR Google heavily promoted the Pixel Watch 4‚Äôs reparability, and a teardown confirms big improvements. Instead of glue, the hardware is held together with screws and gaskets, for easy service. Everything from the battery to the display is replaceable. Of all Google‚Äôs new hardware this season, could the breakout star be a lowly smartwatch? We maybe weren‚Äôt expecting a lot from the Pixel Watch 4 early on, when it sounded like it might be just a minor refresh of past generations. But as we started hearing more about the wearable we found a lot to start getting excited about, and ultimately came to appreciate it as the best-in-class model it really is. One of the big improvements Google‚Äôs been using to promote the Watch 4 is its reparability ‚Äî a consideration that‚Äôs all too often overlooked for wearables. But did the company actually make real progress there, or have those claims been a little oversold? According to the latest iFixit teardown, the Pixel Watch 4 very much delivers when it comes to being able to service its hardware.

title: Samsung‚Äôs One UI 8.5 lock screen clock knows when it‚Äôs in the way
summary: Among other fun design changes, One UI 8.5 gives Samsung‚Äôs lock screen a little self-awareness.
body: Credit: Mishaal Rahman / Android Authority TL;DR The latest One UI 8.5 beta introduces an adaptive clock that adjusts its size and color dynamically according to the wallpaper content. Lock screen weather effects now interact with objects in the wallpaper. A smaller, floating search bar appears in the app drawer, accompanied by a new expanding animation. Samsung‚Äôs next big software update is starting to take shape, and early testers have already spotted some cool cosmetic upgrades in the latest One UI 8.5 beta build. Some well-known leakers experimenting with the new version have revealed several design changes to the lock screen wallpaper and the app drawer.

title: Google Maps gets a community-made solution for its location history mess
summary: This Google Maps Timeline tool will fix your fragmented location history.
body: Credit: Andy Walker / Android Authority TL;DR Google Maps users have had trouble merging old and new Timeline location history or data from separate accounts. A new tool will enable you to merge and convert all of your data into a unified dataset. The tool is a free-to-use web app. If you‚Äôre frustrated with the fact that you can‚Äôt merge your Google Maps Timeline data, you‚Äôre not alone. But you can now end that frustration with the help of a new tool. And the best part is that the tool is free to use. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Samsung‚Äôs making One UI more eSIM-friendly with iPhone porting tool
summary: Samsung is working to make eSIM a little less frustrating ahead of the Galaxy S26.
body: TL;DR Code in a leaked One UI 8.5 build shows Samsung is working on a utility to transfer eSIMs from iOS to Galaxy phones. Moving an eSIM from an iPhone to a Samsung one currently requires contacting your carrier. A One UI 8.5 beta is expected to kick off in November. Using eSIM to move your phone number between two Android phones or two iPhones has been a pretty simple procedure for some time now, but moving from iOS to Android or vice versa is a little more involved. Apple and Google have worked together to streamline the process in iOS 26 and Android 16, but getting your phone number to jump from an iPhone to a Samsung device using eSIM still requires contacting your carrier. It seems like that could change soon, though. We‚Äôve found evidence that Samsung‚Äôs upcoming One UI 8.5 update will include the option to port an eSIM phone number from an iPhone to a Samsung one without having to get your carrier involved. Given Samsung is the leading Android manufacturer, this change could end up benefitting a lot of Android converts.

title: Here‚Äôs our first real look at the Snapdragon 8 Elite-powered AYN Odin 3
summary: AYN finally shows real Odin 3 units, insides and all.
body: Credit: AYN TL;DR AYN posted an update to the Odin 3 Indiegogo page with new details. Development is on schedule, and thermal testing will begin next week. Developer samples will be sent out soon to improve third-party GPU drivers. The AYN Odin 2 remains one of the most groundbreaking and popular Android gaming handhelds on the market, so when the AYN Odin 3 was announced, the hype was off the charts. That only compounded when it was revealed that it would be one of the first Snapdragon 8 Elite gaming handhelds, with the crowdfunding campaign finishing at just over $1 million raised a few days ago. But in the month since the campaign started, very little has been revealed about the device itself. Unlike AYANEO, which typically has a working sample unit before announcing anything to the public, AYN did not appear to have a working prototype. At least, until now.

title: Poll: Do you prefer a black and white or color e-ink display on your e-reader?
summary: Some content makes a strong case for color, but not all of it.
body: E-readers are evolving fast, and not just in storage or refresh rates. Many of the latest models from the biggest brands have brought color e-ink back into the spotlight, promising richer comics, covers, and illustrations without giving up that signature paper-like feel. But for every reader excited to see hues on their home screen, there‚Äôs another who swears grayscale is best. From the Kobo Libra Colour to the Boox P6 Pro series, color displays (like Kaleido 3 panels) are on the rise. These models cater to readers who want graphic novels, children‚Äôs books, textbooks, and other visually rich content to look the way they were intended. Even menus, app icons, and book covers pop with a little color. Meanwhile, highlights and scribbles (on stylus-supported models) also stand out more vividly, which is likely why Amazon just launched a colorful Kindle Scribe , and reMarkable‚Äôs Paper Pro Move now sports a color display too.

title: I wanted to love the Pixel 10 Pro Fold, but Google hasn‚Äôt given me enough reasons to
summary: Magnets are cool and all, but are they worth another $1,800?
body: I‚Äôve never been shy about the fact that I‚Äôm a Pixel fanboy. Pixels are the only phones I‚Äôve ever bought with my own money, and they‚Äôre the reviews I most look forward to writing each year. I want to try the latest software wrinkles, and I just have to know what the new hardware feels like in my hand. And usually, I‚Äôm willing to give Google a lot of grace, because I almost always want to find a reason to like its latest updates. For once, though, I feel like Google has taken the idea of ‚Äúif it ain‚Äôt broke, don‚Äôt fix it‚Äù just a little too far. Google had a perfect window to grace its book-style foldable with the right mix of updates, leapfrogging the Galaxy Z Fold 7‚Ä¶ but it didn‚Äôt. Instead, it‚Äôs given the Pixel 10 Pro Fold the bare minimum, and I just can‚Äôt get excited about it.

title: I‚Äôve ignored this brilliant One UI productivity feature for far too long
summary: This secondary app launcher extends my home screen to almost every other app screen on my phone.
body: Samsung‚Äôs One UI skin has many valuable features , but one I recently rediscovered somehow outdates the company‚Äôs latest user interface. I‚Äôm talking about Edge Panel. This legendary feature has flown under my radar for many years, but I recently rediscovered it in my constant quest to streamline my smartphone setup. I‚Äôm so glad I tried it, as it has added significant utility to my minimalist, productivity-focused home screen. Let me offer a brief tutorial if you aren‚Äôt familiar with Edge Panel or have never used a Samsung phone. The Edge Panel was initially rolled out on Samsung‚Äôs early Edge smartphones, which ran the much-maligned TouchWiz user interface. These devices offered a gimmicky tapered screen edge where icons were placed, effectively turning the side of the phone‚Äôs screen into a secondary display packed with shortcuts. The idea was solid, but I never appreciated the execution.

title: Lenovo‚Äôs Yoga Tab Plus is a gorgeous Android tablet, but that‚Äôs not nearly enough
summary: It looks good, but there are better options out there.
body: I‚Äôm constantly on the lookout for ways to replace my laptop. It‚Äôs not that I don‚Äôt like my 15-inch MacBook Air (I really do), I just don‚Äôt love toting it with me while I travel. Along the way, I‚Äôve tried a rotating cast of Android tablets , foldable phones, and Chromebooks, but nothing has quite stuck. So, when Lenovo announced its first AI-powered tablet, the Yoga Tab Plus (), I figured I had to give it a try. After all, with a long summer of travel ahead of me, I thought that features like the Snapdragon 8 Gen 3 chipset, dual cameras, and a suite of included accessories would cover me for everything from a camping trip away from reliable Wi-Fi to a marathon in the most remote corner of my home state.

title: BOOX‚Äôs latest Android e-reader turns the page on connectivity
summary: Color E-Ink meets 5G in this portable device.
body: TL;DR BOOX has officially launched two versions of the BOOX P6 Pro in China: a black and white model and a color model. All P6 Pro variants feature a hybrid SIM/microSD slot with 5G data. Launch prices are set at roughly $463 (B&W model) and $353 (Color model) with early-buyer discounts, but global availability has not yet been announced. Onyx is once again blurring the line between e-readers and smartphones. After some details surfaced earlier this week, the company officially launched two versions of the new BOOX P6 Pro in China: a traditional black-and-white model and a splashier Kaleido 3 color variant, both featuring built-in SIM support for 5G connectivity. The Pro series marks a major leap for the lineup. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: The Amazon Echo Pop and Dot are still on sale!
summary: There's a reason I see these smart speakers everywhere.
body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority Amazon‚Äôs Prime Big Deal Days are over, but that doesn‚Äôt mean the discounts have to go away. While most certainly have, there are still some fantastic offers to be had. For example, the Amazon Echo Pop and Dot are still at the same discounted price, saving you $15. Buy the Amazon Echo Pop for just $24.99 ($15 off)

title: NYC sues Google and other social media giants over their addictive platforms
summary: NYC alleges platforms like Facebook and YouTube intentionally hook kids for profit.
body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR New York City has filed a lawsuit against tech giants, like Meta, Google, Snapchat, and TikTok. The lawsuit alleges that social media platforms are fueling a mental health crisis among children. Google denies the allegations. A lot of good can be done with the help of social media, such as raising awareness for a cause. At the same time, there‚Äôs a darker side that can cause harm. Regardless of whether social media is a net positive or negative, New York City has had enough. The city, along with its school districts and health department, is now suing the tech giants that run these platforms. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Want a foldable? The Samsung‚Äôs hottest ones are up to $470 off!
summary: Amazon's Prime Big Deal Days may be over, but Samsung doesn't care!
body: Credit: Lanh Nguyen / Android Authority I am still in awe that we have foldable screens. We‚Äôre living the future, and Samsung is one of the market leaders in this sector. Its hottest ones right now are the Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 7 and Galaxy Z Flip 7. They are both on sale right now, and they come with free storage upgrades! Buy the Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 7 with 512GB for just $1,649.99 ($470 off)

title: Gemini prompt bar gets sheet redesign, absorbing the model picker
summary: After adding the ‚ÄúTools‚Äù menu last month, a redesign of the Gemini app‚Äôs prompt bar removes the box, while the model picker is being moved. more‚Ä¶

title: US Mobile is offering 3 unlimited lines for the price of just one, too good to be true?
summary: Right now US Mobile is offering 3 unlimited lines for the price of just one for an entire year!
body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR US Mobile‚Äôs new promo gives two free lines for one year when buying an annual Unlimited Premium or Starter plan, lowering cost to about $11/month per line. Premium buyers get two free Starter lines; Starter buyers get two free Unlimited Flex lines, all required to stay on the AT&T-based ‚ÄúDark Star‚Äù network. The deal aims to drive more users to Dark Star following US Mobile‚Äôs expanded AT&T partnership allowing full unlimited data and new perks. From low-cost Pixel phone deals to aggressively priced annual promos, US Mobile has had a good year when it comes to offering its customers solid deals. Now it‚Äôs offering one of its most impressive deals to date. Simply put, if you buy an annual Unlimited Premium or Unlimited Starter plan, you‚Äôll receive two additional lines for a year at no cost. Depending on the plan, this works out to around $11 or even less a month per line. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: YouTube will start letting the worst creators back on the platform
summary: The streaming giant spells out its plan to backtrack on creator accountability.
body: TL;DR YouTube will begin letting certain terminated creators make new channels. Eligible accounts will see the option appear at some point over the next few weeks. The company notes that ‚Äúnot every type of channel termination will be eligible‚Äù but seems intentionally vague on details. YouTube policy enforcement isn‚Äôt great, to put things mildly, and the platform has a reputation for often being unnecessarily difficult for creators, exposing them to spurious copyright claims and the like. But for all the ways YouTube struggles there, we‚Äôve had to give Google credit for the steps it‚Äôs taken to silence some of the worst people you‚Äôll find both on- and offline, spreading politically motivated lies and doing real harm through their messaging. And now, in all its wisdom, it‚Äôs letting them back . Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Prime Day may be over, but these Retroid handheld console deals are just getting started
summary: Save up to 10% off Retroid's gaming handhelds thanks to these new price cuts.
body: TL;DR Retroid is discounting three of its most popular handheld consoles. Prices of the Pocket 5, Pocket Mini V2, Pocket Flip 2 have all been slashed by $20. This week has already been an exciting ‚Äî if not a little overwhelming ‚Äî one for fans of deals on their favorite tech, with tons of October Prime Day sales over at Amazon keeping us busy. While that formally wrapped up yesterday, there are still plenty of fantastic deals left to be found, and not just on Amazon. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Here‚Äôs your first look at Gemini in Google Maps navigation
summary: Google's gearing up to kick Assistant out of Maps.
body: TL;DR We were able to activate a new Gemini integration in the latest Google Maps beta. Gemini will eventually replace the Google Assistant for hands-free control during navigation. The change isn‚Äôt live in any user-facing version of Maps, but we expect it could be coming soon in an update. Google‚Äôs still engaged in a years-long project to replace the legacy Google Assistant with its newer Gemini AI assistant across its entire ecosystem. It looks like Google Maps navigation is next in line for that treatment. Experimenting with version 25.41.03.815390258 beta of the Google Maps app, we were able to activate a new Gemini integration. When enabled, this integration sees Gemini respond when you tap the microphone icon in the top right corner of the navigation interface, rather than the the Google Assistant. This is the second in-progress Google Maps/Gemini integration we‚Äôve spotted this week.

title: WhatsApp not working on your Wear OS watch? Take this step
summary: Various users experienced a critical issue with the app this week, but a fix has already rolled out.
body: Credit: Rita El Khoury / Android Authority TL;DR WhatsApp for Wear OS briefly stopped working this week, showing an ‚Äúobsolete‚Äù version error. Samsung, OnePlus, and other watch owners were affected across various Wear OS builds. A new Play Store update has since fixed the issue for most users. WhatsApp briefly stopped working on Wear OS smartwatches this week, with many users suddenly finding the app unusable. Opening it brought up a message stating that the version had become ‚Äúobsolete‚Äù and needed updating, despite the users believing that the latest version was already installed. Thankfully, it appears that the issue may have now been resolved.

title: Deals: Pixel Tablet at $190 off from $249, most affordable Galaxy Fold 7 at $400 off, and more
summary: Amazon fall Prime Day is long gone for another year now, but the deals are still flying in today‚Äôs 9to5Toys Lunch Break. We are still tracking up to $190 off Google Pixel Tablet with deals from $249, and Amazon is offering all three colors it offers on the most affordable Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 7 at‚Ä¶

summary: Every phone manufacturer wants to make a thin phone now, and one of the most experienced ones is showing exactly why it‚Äôs been in the game so long. Motorola‚Äôs upcoming Edge 70 is reportedly going to bring a much bigger battery than what the most popular thin options can offer. more‚Ä¶

summary: Google‚Äôs new Nest Doorbell (wired) is here and, if you‚Äôre looking to upgrade over the existing model, the good news is that it‚Äôs a truly effortless upgrade. more‚Ä¶

title: Leak mercilessly unwraps Motorola‚Äôs upcoming Galaxy S25 Edge rival
summary: Highlighting barely any upgrade over the previous Motorola Edge other than the design.
body: Credit: X-Kom TL;DR Motorola‚Äôs upcoming slim phone has leaked entirely. A Polish e-commerce website has revealed its specifications, design, and colors. Motorola has begun teasing the phone in China, where it is expected to launch next month. Motorola has already confirmed that it is joining the thin-and-light-phone club alongside the likes of Samsung, Apple, and Tecno. After all, Motorola‚Äôs flagship lineup already has an Edge over the others. The slim phone, likely called the Edge 70 globally, is set to arrive in China first as the Edge 70 Air . And while its decently sized battery and fast charging speeds have already been confirmed officially, a recent leak has spilled the beans on the rest of the specifications. The Edge 70 has already been listed for sale by the Polish e-commerce website X-Kom (via GSMArena ). The listing reveals the design of the Edge 70, along with different color options and a comprehensive list of specifications. It also echoes the officially revealed battery capacity and charging speeds.

title: TAG Heuer calls timeout on Wear OS with its latest luxury smartwatch
summary: The custom OS ensures better iPhone connectivity, while a "Made for iPhone" certification further cements it.
body: Credit: TAG Heuer TL;DR Luxury watchmaker TAG Heuer has just launched its newest smartwatch, the Connected Calibre E5. After relying on Google‚Äôs Wear OS for nearly a decade, it is switching to a custom interface to fix connectivity issues with the iPhone. TAG Heuer went a step further, securing a ‚ÄúMade for iPhone‚Äù certification for the smartwatch. Google‚Äôs Wear OS has been the choice of interface for several generations of TAG Heuer Connected series smartwatches. However, the luxury watchmaker is changing that with the latest generation of the series, replacing Wear OS with a custom operating system that plays well with the iPhone. TAG Heuer‚Äôs recently launched Connected Calibre E5 comes with a custom operating system bearing its name. The TAG Heuer OS, which replaces Wear OS on the Calibre E5, is claimed to be built ‚Äúentirely in-house‚Äù for a ‚Äúfluid, intuitive interface designed for seamless navigation.‚Äù WIRED notes that the OS is still based on Android, but these customizations will allow the smartwatch to also be compatible with iOS.

title: Google‚Äôs $999 Pixel 10 Pro flagship struggles with jerky zoom videos, but you can fix it yourself
summary: The telephoto camera stutters in video recordings across the Pixel 10 lineup, potentially on older Pixels too.
body: Credit: Ryan Haines / Android Authority TL;DR A software bug involving Electronic Image Stabilization (EIS) causes jittery video recording on the Pixel 10 series‚Äô telephoto camera. The issue persists across multiple apps, including third-party ones that utilize Google‚Äôs EIS API. Ironically, the stuttering can be fixed by turning off video stabilization in the Pixel camera app. The Google Pixel 10 series includes some fantastic smartphones, but they aren‚Äôt perfect by any means. The Pixel lineup is infamous for having more than its fair share of bugs , and users must deal with them on new phones while also considering the possibility that it could be a hardware defect. One Reddit user found themselves in this spot when they noticed stuttering when video recording through the 5x telephoto camera. Thankfully, it seems this is a software bug related to EIS, so there‚Äôs hope of it being fixed through a software update once Google acknowledges the issue. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Nothing made a ‚Äòdream phone‚Äô for MrWhoseTheBoss, so what does it look like?
summary: This dream phone would have a crazy $1,800 price tag.
body: TL;DR Nothing has teamed up with YouTuber MrWhoseTheBoss to ‚Äúmake‚Äù his hypothetical dream phone. The manufacturer didn‚Äôt actually produce the phone but created renders and a list of specs. This phone would retail for $1,800 and have a 10x periscope camera, sapphire glass screen, and more. Nothing previously mocked up popular tech YouTuber Marques ‚ÄòMKBHD‚Äô Brownlee‚Äôs ideal flagship phone . Now, it‚Äôs enlisted the help of another popular tech YouTuber to make another hypothetical dream phone. Nothing teamed up with Arun Maini (MrWhoseTheBoss) and mocked up his ideal Android phone, posting a video to YouTube in the process. You can check out the full video above.

title: Google Maps may soon let you ask about places like you‚Äôre in the Gemini app
summary: Ask Maps may become the first thing you see in the Google Maps app.
body: Credit: Andy Walker / Android Authority TL;DR An Ask Maps chip is being added to the homepage of the Google Maps app. Tapping on the chip opens a bottom sheet that resembles the UI of the Gemini app. The feature is still a work in progress, as there are a few issues. Last year, Google introduced an AI-powered feature to the Maps called ‚Äú Ask Maps .‚Äù This feature allowed you to find places to go and things to do by typing natural language questions into the search bar. In a new APK teardown, we have discovered that the tech giant is working to expand upon this feature. title: This Pixel Watch 4 feature has changed how I use a smartwatch
summary: After using the Pixel Watch 4, I don't know how I could ever do without it.
body: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8yEb6Xuwg38 For the past year, the Google Pixel Watch 3 has barely left my wrist. It‚Äôs been a fantastic and reliable smartwatch. It does everything I expect it to do and does it well. However, at its core, it‚Äôs just a typical smartwatch. My habits remained the same: I‚Äôd glance at notifications, manually start tracking my bike ride in the Fitbit app, or swipe over to a widget to check the weather. My watch was a convenient, wrist-mounted second screen for my phone, but it was largely a passive experience. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Amazon‚Äôs newest Kindle accessory celebrates creative clutter
summary: It's a great time to be a sticker.
body: TL;DR Amazon launched clear-back Kindle covers for the Paperwhite and Colorsoft models. Each cover ships with a sticker pack to help users kick off their customization The covers cost $36.99, the same as standard fabric covers. Amazon quietly launched a new set of clear-back fabric cases for its e-readers, complete with a sticker pack. The new accessories lean into the existing culture of cover decorating within the Kindle community. The covers also mark an interesting signal from Amazon itself. For years, Kindles have leaned on a minimalist identity: matte finishes, muted colors, and quiet logos. The new covers invite a little more chaos and a lot more customization. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: This underrated app is better than YouTube Music, but I‚Äôm still not switching
summary: For one reason alone.
body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority YouTube Music is great, but Deezer is better. The French music streaming service is highly underrated in my opinion and deserves a lot more attention. However, despite my love for Deezer, there are issues holding it back, with one of them being a dealbreaker for me. I can‚Äôt justify switching over to it from YouTube Music, but I still think it‚Äôs a great option for certain users in the US.

title: Google TV could soon let you generate and watch your own videos
summary: And could bring about a new age of learning for kids.
body: Credit: Ryan Haines / Android Authority TL;DR Google TV may soon use Gemini to generate animated videos in response to questions. This might utilize a feature called Sparkify, which uses Gemini and Veo to create videos to help kids learn concepts or help them study. Sparkify is also available as an experimental feature for other devices. Gemini recently made its big screen debut with its launch on Google TV . Although it‚Äôs currently limited to a small set of smart TVs, alongside the Google TV streamer, Gemini has been promised to be rolled out to a broader set of Google TV models later in the year. While gearing up for the launch, Google is seemingly testing some AI-powered features to improve your video-watching experience. title: TCL‚Äôs compact, versatile, and portable Google TV projector is now $100 off for Prime
summary: The TCL Projector C1 is one of the most versatile and affordable Google TV projectors you can buy right now.
body: Credit: TCL TCL‚Äôs Projector C1 is one of the top choices for compact and portable Google TV projectors . This seriously cool device has a footprint roughly the size of a small lunchbox, with a cute handle that doubles as its stand. It‚Äôs already one of the more affordable Google TV projectors out there, but now it‚Äôs even more tempting with $100 off for Prime Big Deal Days .

title: Fall asleep while binge-watching? This Google TV feature might be for you (APK teardown)
summary: Google TV could detect if you haven't used your remote for a while. And here's why.
body: Credit: C. Scott Brown / Android Authority TL;DR An Android Authority teardown has revealed that Google TV could check if you‚Äôre still watching a channel. Google TV would run these checks if you haven‚Äôt used your remote in a while. The platform would then stop playing the channel if you don‚Äôt respond to the prompt. Some streaming services, like Netflix , offer a pop-up to check if you‚Äôre still watching a series. This is especially handy if you‚Äôve fallen asleep. Now, we‚Äôve discovered that Google TV itself could get a similar prompt. NEWSLETTER | Authority Insights --> Authority Insights You're reading an Authority Insights story. title: This new Ring camera feature is seriously creeping people out
summary: Facial recognition meets your front door, and not everyone's thrilled about it.
body: Credit: Stephen Schenck / Android Authority TL;DR Amazon‚Äôs new ‚ÄúFamiliar Faces‚Äù feature gives Ring cameras and doorbells facial recognition powers, and people aren‚Äôt too happy about it. Both Ring users and non-users are uneasy about the feature because of potential legal, security, and privacy risks. The feature won‚Äôt launch in states with strict facial recognition laws like Illinois and Texas. Amazon recently announced a new facial recognition feature for Ring doorbells and cameras called ‚ÄúFamiliar Faces.‚Äù The feature isn‚Äôt even out yet, but it‚Äôs already raising eyebrows because of how popular Ring security cameras have become over the years.

title: Grab the Anker SOLIX F3000 power station for $1,399
summary: Save a whopping $1,200 on one of my favorite power stations.
body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority If you‚Äôre prepping for power outages or want a reliable energy source for your adventures, check out the Anker SOLIX F3000 portable power station during this year‚Äôs Amazon Prime Big Deal Days sales event. title: The LG StanbyME 2 smart monitor drops below $1,000 for the first time

One notable offer that should catch your eye is on the LG StanbyME 2, which is now available for $996.99, down from its usual price of $1,299.99. That‚Äôs a solid discount, making it the lowest price this year, beating the previous $1,196.99 mark. Buy the LG StanbyME 2 for $996.99 (23% off)
